channel.title: I-Bot beta testing
channel.description:
Let the revolution begin. Although this bot has a user friendly user interface, It is in the intial testing stages. This version is to only test scripts and let users have a head start on writing advance color functions.
We encourage users to use Eclipse to develop scripts.
How to become a tester: http://www.impsoft.net/forums/showthread.php?t=445 or submit a application
no leaking please

item.title: I-Bot beta testing
item.dc:creator: @GenoDemoN GenoDemoN
item.description:
@GenoDemoN wrote:

i-bot is multi client it has less lagg than scar there will be chec rate settings so you can set it lower say at waamp level for throw away accts and run easily 4+ or set it high for your autoing main and run i dont know yet.

Read full topic

item.title: I-Bot beta testing
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

But if it is always cheaking for randoms and profroming actions, how many clients can you run before the lag becomes unbearable?
Or is I-bot not multi-client?.

Read full topic

item.title: I-Bot beta testing
item.dc:creator: @GenoDemoN GenoDemoN
item.description:
@GenoDemoN wrote:

no problem, but the things is it still will only be able to check one randoma ta time and the delay bettween the communication and the script stopping can fail a random. thats why i-bot will be optimal cause it will have the ability to ALWAYs be checking for randoms and if the code is good it will never fail a random.

Read full topic

item.title: I-Bot beta testing
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

[quote=“GenoDemoN, post:86, topic:4605”]i-bot is so far fully in java but with java we can inlcude any other code for accessory methods.
inicially we are going to write java equivalent of srl’s anti randoms as a first step to getting i bot off its feet then replace them with newer fast functions with better algorithms
the BEST anti-randoms to date with the current system sure is srl cause they are the only ones that people are stuill publishing. the greatest random event handler evet was waamp, it used a communicator that i made for wallfire and wallfire got a bunch of scripters together and amde anti-randoms that were always checking in a seprate sca window with the send interscar message with some handshaking the script then stopped whenever waamp needed to do a random event. it died when a crap laod of new randoms came out around 1 year ago and no-1 upadted it.[/quote]A few of us are looking into something like that
Actuly we got the idea from you and wallfire

So thank you?

Read full topic

item.title: I-Bot beta testing
item.dc:creator: @GenoDemoN GenoDemoN
item.description:
@GenoDemoN wrote:

i-bot is so far fully in java but with java we can inlcude any other code for accessory methods.
inicially we are going to write java equivalent of srl’s anti randoms as a first step to getting i bot off its feet then replace them with newer fast functions with better algorithms
the BEST anti-randoms to date with the current system sure is srl cause they are the only ones that people are stuill publishing. the greatest random event handler evet was waamp, it used a communicator that i made for wallfire and wallfire got a bunch of scripters together and amde anti-randoms that were always checking in a seprate sca window with the send interscar message with some handshaking the script then stopped whenever waamp needed to do a random event. it died when a crap laod of new randoms came out around 1 year ago and no-1 upadted it.

Read full topic

item.title: I-Bot beta testing
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

[quote=“GenoDemoN, post:75, topic:4605”]bebe you cannot deny that if the randoms are on another thread the chance of them failing will be heavily reduced to 0. heres another one for you i was using wizzups powerminer and after 15 minutes i got a swarm then in another around 15 minutes i was dead cause i idled there dieing.[/quote]I am not trying to tell you that SRL randoms are flawless, by far that is the case, they have their flaws, but they are the best anti-randoms (in SCAR) to date.

Ruler, are you making your own randoms, or using SRL’s?
And is I-bot fully in Java? (I don’t pay a lot of attention to impsoft, sorry :o)

Read full topic

item.title: I-Bot beta testing
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

[quote=“Bebemycat2, post:61, topic:4605”]FindNormalRandoms:

{******************************************************************************* procedure FindNormalRandoms; by: The SRL Developers Team!... all time sexiness by Mutant Description: Calls the 'normal' random checks. *******************************************************************************} Function FindNormalRandoms: Boolean; var i: Integer; begin for i:=1 to 17 do begin case I of 1: CloseWindow; 2: If FindTalk then Result := True; 3: If FindDead then Result := True; 4: If FindMod then Result := True; 5: If FindMime then Result := True; 6: If FindMaze then Result := True; 7: If FindQuiz then Result := True; 8: If FindDemon then Result := True; 9: If FindScapeRune then Result := True; 10: If FindTalk then // Call it twice Result := True; 11: Respond; 12: If FindLamp(LampSkill) then // Maybe we missed it? Result := True; 13: If(FindNewBox)then begin Result := True; if(UseBoxSolver)then SolveBox else GambleNewBox; end; 14: If FindTrade then Result := True; 15: begin if NoGameTab then begin Result := True; Players[CurrentPlayer].loc := 'No GameTab'; Logout; Exit; end; end; 16: SaveToChatLog; 17: If SolvePinball then Result := True; end; wait(1); end; end;
Yes it does find all randoms.

New results(this is when I just had Scar and RS going:
Time taken to find normal randoms is 390
Time taken to find normal randoms is 390
Time taken to find normal randoms is 391
Time taken to find normal randoms is 390

So adverage for me on this run is:
290.25

compaired to my last adverage of:
1734.666

That was with a lot of programs going and me downloading a large file, and yes I was logged out because I did not feel like logging in to test a simple script like the one I used.

So even then it is still a good time to find randoms.[/quote]

also scar is unable to do random checks when its moving the mouse.

I-Bot Daemon threads
-Black Dot (Also updates the list of Current Applets)
-GUI
also I-Bot has about 3 Threads per bot
-Script
-Random
-Input (mouse,keys, mouse move)

Also the input thread can have its orders change mid mouse motion. If a order is sent to it, it drops whatever is left from the last order and starts on new one.

When a random is active, a script can still look for colors and what not, but if it sends a command to input thread, it will be force to sleep until the random has stopped, then the command is sent to the input thread.

Read full topic

item.title: I-Bot beta testing
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Xerxes:

Go away fgt. Youre just kissing their ass to probably beta test some bot or something, fgt.

Yes, it dose seem I’m kissing there ass at the min, dosen’t it?

It’s all fine when you flame other people, it’s funny at times, but really, you do not back up your statements, you repeat yourself and you getting old, fast. I don’t feal right at ImpSoft’s boards, as you can probally tell by my activity. This time, Geno and ruler are doing somthing free, either they got real rich off there Aryan or they’ve really changed, I know what one I think is right but either way, there doing somthing good.

Go ahead, flame me with your pathetic 1 line post’s, but the fact remains, to be a beta tester you need 15 rep on ImpSoft, and the only place I’ve got 10+ rep was Kaitnieks and SRL, SRL for releasing a script witch is instant 30 rep. So either way, unless I really start kissing there ass I won’t be a beta tester for awhile.

  • “kthxbye”

And yes, Xerxes, I got a challange for you, go ahead, flame me, but only in PM’s to me. Lets see how long till you get bored of me and flame someone else.

Read full topic

item.title: I-Bot beta testing
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

the core bot will be free.

their might be non-essential features down the road that are pay or even custom scripts.[br][size=1]Posted at: July 11, 2006, 08:01:17 AM[/size][hr][quote=“The Un-Named, post:70, topic:4605”][quote author=GenoDemoN link=topic=5996.msg61227#msg61227 date=1152572993]why not?? scar is the bulkiest thing it has survived for soo long cause people think its the best. go look @ srl they have spent what 9 10 monts and thats all they have almsot none of thier scripts can rn more than 30 minutes till a random event screws it up.[/quote]

That’s why SRL has multiple users, one gets random, we switch. Sure, using one character and 30 mins, poof, gone, but using multiple characters, 30 mins each.

Now, what are the chances of getting an unsolvable random every 30~ mins on 10 characters?

Another noob ripped bot released by IMP-Rippers.

What did they rip it off? Thin air?

[quote author=ruler link=topic=5996.msg61217#msg61217 date=1152572684]benland100
(200 lines) b-spline mouse curves
(0 hours)
[/quote]

I’m sure he spent atleast 1 hour making the scripts. Now, right here I’m being difficult.

correct you have them all solved, but the scripts aren’t checking randoms enough for them to be always caught.

If the script dosen’t find the random 3~ seconds after an activity at most, then the script can be improved.

i need hard data, on timings. Unless we are the only ones, the longest test we have had a srl scripts is 51 minutes. They always fail due to randoms. Therefore we think randoms aren’t being check too often. It was the dev version of the varrock guard killer in varrock.[/quote]

As I said just now, the script can be improved. No matter who made it, a script will have it’s flaws.

ok and info on tolerance i you can. you dont hav to tolerance on the bitmap espcailly

and do bitmap searchs continue and only reutnr best match or do they stop at first match?

I beleve that all bitmap finding functions apart from FindBitmapDeformed stop at first match, but then it takes 20 lines max to find more if there is more and result how many where found.

Xerxes, don’t presume stuff you don’t know is true.

To ruler and Geno, I’m really not sure what to think about you two any more. You got the odvious rippers that think of nothing but money, and you got the two hard workers making a bot for everyone to use free. Yes, you’ve done great works and your history isn’t exactly perfect, but look at this: [quote author=SETO link=topic=5996.msg61283#msg61283 date=1152574698]
Ruler is it gona be free bot or pay to use? (i know you guys mostely never give out anything for free and its ok just checking)

I think that sums it all up. I’d say “Look at that and try to find a way to stop quotes like this”, but you already are. :)[/quote]
The timing in the credits is how much they spent on this bot, not making the code for other projects.

I don’t see how the bot is idea stealing…

ibot scripts will fail less often tha scar scripts. This is due to ibot scripts not having randomCheck() in the script

Read full topic
